I am 27m. I have been battling gambling addiction for a while. I always tell myself i would stop. This time i fucked up bad.

I was moneyless cause i gambled away my paycheck. It was going well, i didn't need any money so it was fine. Then, the other day, i got fined while driving. I asked for a cash advance on my paycheck, i wanted a small sum (paycheck is due in less than a week anyway), and my boss gave me almost all of it instead. I gambled it away. Again.
I wanted to use that money to go on vacation, to take a break from my bleak life. Now i can't.
27 years and i squandered away everything. I have a good paying job, i should have a lot of money, instead this year i got wrapped into this and can't find a way out.
I am beyond help.

Not sure what flair but here it goes Everyday I wake up of wanting to end myself. Having thoughts everyday 24/7 on when should I do it. I also have been saving money so I can least leave a savings to my family. I tried exercising lost about 10kgs (im obese btw) and though the thoughts would go away but even during that time when I am doing some workout I keep thinking its not worth it you are not going to make it you are a fuck up. Then that 10kg came back and now I fear I may get diabetes, my family has a history of it. I tried all of the distractions. I keep getting back to that point that i just keep eating and eating and just doomscrolling just staring at my screen. Even at work I just want it to end. Been thinking about it by 30 I might do it and I am just counting down. Even found a way to do it painless.

I (f25) feel deeply confused, hurt and emotionally exhausted by my mum and my sister, and I donâ€™t know how Iâ€™m supposed to feel or what the â€œrightâ€ reaction is anymore. My mum has always had serious anger issues and when I try to speak to her about how sheâ€™s hurt me, she immediately deflects, raises her voice and turns it around on me instead of taking any accountability, and her shouting is genuinely scary and overwhelming. After one of her outbursts, Iâ€™m just expected to forget it and go back to normal, and I feel like Iâ€™m constantly walking on eggshells because if she hears even the slightest â€œoffâ€ tone in my voice she kicks off again. My sister, who is 23, has always been horrible to me â€” she speaks in a rude, sharp tone, says things like â€œwhat?â€ when I talk, controls the entire house and dictates how quiet it must be at night, and my parents just follow along like theyâ€™re afraid of her. I canâ€™t ever speak up about her behaviour because my mum instantly jumps to her defence and says things like â€œthatâ€™s just who she is,â€ â€œsheâ€™s a grown woman, I canâ€™t punish her,â€ or â€œIâ€™m trying the soft approach,â€ which basically tells me itâ€™s okay for her to treat me badly. What hurts even more is that she is perfectly capable of being kind and respectful, because she is lovely to other people like my cousin, apologising constantly and worrying about upsetting him â€” which proves to me that the way she treats me is a choice thatâ€™s enabled by my mum. Since being in hospital on telemetry for a week and being diagnosed with epilepsy, and finding out about SUDEP (sudden unexplained death in epilepsy)â€” something my family knows very well about â€” my ability to cope with stress has changed, and it is devastating that my mum still shouts, argues and creates a hostile environment knowing the impact it has on me. Stress is a trigger for s3izure. The other day when she was shouting at my dad, I finally reacted (which I rarely do), and she went absolutely crazy at me to the point I walked out, yet when they were messaging me for two hours saying they were worried, as soon as I came back she kicked off again. The next day she expected everything to just be normal, and when I stayed quiet to protect myself, she could tell I was distant, and Iâ€™ve been struggling to forgive her ever since. Even when she apologises, she only does it when Iâ€™m away at work or my boyfriendâ€™s, and then when Iâ€™m upset again she takes it back and minimises what she did, saying things like â€œwhat did I even do that was so bad?â€ or â€œyouâ€™re only angry because according to you I was rude,â€ and when I mention the apology, she twists it into â€œso my apology meant nothing then?â€ which makes me feel guilty and doubting myself. She then says sheâ€™s a terrible mum and her family is broken, and because she and my dad barely speak and my sister treats her badly too, I feel like Iâ€™m abandoning her when Iâ€™m just trying to protect myself, which hurts because Iâ€™m the only one who really shows her kindness and respect. I also feel torn because when sheâ€™s not angry she can be kind, funny and caring, which makes me doubt my own feelings and makes it even harder to stay upset. On top of that, I feel pressure because itâ€™s almost Christmas and sheâ€™s 59 and I worry â€œwhat if this is her last Christmas and Iâ€™ve made it miserable?â€ which leaves me stuck between my pain and my guilt. I donâ€™t want to leave my home, my dog or the comfort and privacy of my own space, and even though my boyfriend would let me stay with him, Iâ€™d feel like a burden or judged in his familyâ€™s home. Right now it feels like when I speak Iâ€™m punished, when Iâ€™m silent Iâ€™m punished, and the only way to survive is to swallow everything and let my sister continue controlling everyone, even though it is slowly breaking me inside.

M37 here. I was straight and married till 2022. Somehow back then I felt bored with life, with wife et al.. Ended up cheated on her, then experimented a bit more, had gay sex and a whole new world of pleasure opened up. After some escapades met a genuinely compassionate man, who was also married then, and something immediately clicked. We both came out, got divorced and started a new life together. It has been wonderful 3 years but there's trouble in paradise. I'm not all getting arosed by my partner or by any men for that matter now. Its like my brain had enough thrill from it and now completely rejecting it. I've gone thru enough pain and caused enough turmoil once already, and dont know whats happening and why its happening. Never thought sexuality had on and off phases. I'm confused and to add on to that, feeling guilty for first making my ex wife go thru this and now my partner, both whom are wonderful individuals. They didn't/don't deserves this for sure. Is it just me or anyone had similar experience?
